Module jacob.mainscreen
Package jacob.mainscreen

Class HelloController

java.lang.Object
jacob.mainscreen.HelloController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class HelloController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The HelloController class is the controller for the main screen of the application. The main screen is responsible for enabling switching to the other screens of the application, as well as editing the Part and Product Tables.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller and sets all the Part and Product objects to their tables.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The URL is used to tell the code where to get the data from.
      resourceBundle - The resources being used by the main menu that are being initialized.

    • OnClickAddPartButton

      public void OnClickAddPartButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The OnClickAddPartButton method is used to switch to the add part screen when the button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

      Throws:

    • OnClickExitProgramButton

      public void OnClickExitProgramButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The OnClickExitProgramButton method is used to close the application when the button is clicked.

    • OnClickSearchPartButton

      public void OnClickSearchPartButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The OnClickSearchPartButton is used to parse the input in the text field and use it to search the list of Parts. It uses both the search by name and search by id in tandem to ensure the correct Part is located.

    • OnClickSearchProductButton

      public void OnClickSearchProductButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The OnClickSearchProductButton is used to parse the input in the text field and use it to search the list of Products. It uses both the search by name and search by id in tandem to ensure the correct Product is located.

    • OnClickDeletePartButton

      public void OnClickDeletePartButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Deletes a part from the displayPartsTable and inventory.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent associated with the delete part button click.

    • OnClickDeleteProductButton

      public void OnClickDeleteProductButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The OnClickDeleteProductButton is used to delete the selected Product from the product table. The deleteProduct will only run if there are no associated parts attached to the Product Object being selected and will ask the user to confirm the action before it is performed.
